Specimen Type: Sputum, bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) fluids, gastric washings, tissue biopsies, other body fluids
Purpose: To detect Mycobacterium species by identifying acid-fast bacilli in clinical specimens.
Container: Sterile, leak-proof container appropriate to specimen type
Equipment: Biological safety cabinet, microscope (oil immersion), glass slides, inoculating loop, heat source, staining reagents (carbolfuchsin, acid-alcohol, methylene blue or malachite green)
